alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 4:28AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Jordan Creek in Juneau. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 AM AKDT, River gauge reported that Jordan Creek crested at 10.73 around 1030 PM Monday Night and is falling quickly. The water levels is presently 9.7 feet ( flood stage 9.7 feet) expected to fall below action stage in the next few hours so will continue the Flood Warning. Flooding is ongoing, especially near Jordan Creek. Between 1.75 and 2.4 inches of rain had fallen in this event. - Areas around the Jordan Creek Mall is the most likely place to experience flooding. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 2:00am the stage was 10.25 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.7 feet is expected around 10:00pm Monday.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
